verses.verse: The burden <S%H4853><s%> which Habakkuk <S%H2265><s%> the prophet <S%H5030><s%> did see <S%H2372><s%>.
O Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, how long shall I cry <S%H7768><s%>, and thou wilt not hear <S%H8085><s%>? I cry out <S%H2199><s%> unto thee of violence <S%H2555><s%>, and thou wilt not save <S%H3467><s%>.

Why dost thou show <S%H7200><s%> me iniquity <S%H205><s%>, and look <S%H5027><s%> upon perverseness <S%H5999><s%>? for destruction <S%H7701><s%> and violence <S%H2555><s%> are before me <S%H7379><s%>; and there is strife, and contention <S%H4066><s%> riseth up <S%H5375><s%>.

Therefore the law <S%H8451><s%> is slacked <S%H6313><s%>, and justice <S%H4941><s%> doth never <S%H5331><s%> go forth <S%H3318><s%>; for the wicked <S%H7563><s%> doth compass <S%H3803><s%> about the righteous <S%H6662><s%>; therefore justice <S%H4941><s%> goeth forth <S%H3318><s%> perverted <S%H6127><s%>.

Behold <S%H7200><s%> ye among the nations <S%H1471><s%>, and look <S%H5027><s%>, and wonder <S%H8539><s%> marvellously <S%H8539><s%>; for I am working <S%H6466><s%> a work <S%H6467><s%> in your days <S%H3117><s%>, which ye will not believe <S%H539><s%> though it be told you <S%H5608><s%>.

For <S%H6965><s%>, lo, I raise up the Chaldeans <S%H3778><s%>, that bitter <S%H4751><s%> and hasty <S%H4116><s%> nation <S%H1471><s%>, that march <S%H1980><s%> through the breadth <S%H4800><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>, to possess <S%H3423><s%> dwelling-places <S%H4908><s%> that are not theirs.
They are terrible <S%H366><s%> and dreadful <S%H3372><s%>; their judgment <S%H4941><s%> and their dignity <S%H7613><s%> proceed from themselves <S%H3318><s%>.

Their horses <S%H5483><s%> also are swifter <S%H7043><s%> than leopards <S%H5246><s%>, and are more fierce <S%H2300><s%> than the evening <S%H6153><s%> wolves <S%H2061><s%>; and their horsemen <S%H6571><s%> press proudly <S%H6335><s%> on <S%H6571><s%>: yea, their horsemen come <S%H935><s%> from far <S%H7350><s%>; they fly <S%H5774><s%> as an eagle <S%H5404><s%> that hasteth <S%H2363><s%> to devour <S%H398><s%>.

They come <S%H935><s%> all of them for violence <S%H2555><s%>; the set <S%H4041><s%> of their faces <S%H6440><s%> is forwards <S%H6921><s%>; and they gather <S%H622><s%> captives <S%H7628><s%> as the sand <S%H2344><s%>.

Yea <S%H7046><s%>, he scoffeth at kings <S%H4428><s%>, and princes <S%H7336><s%> are a derision <S%H4890><s%> unto him <S%H7832><s%>; he derideth every stronghold <S%H4013><s%>; for he heapeth <S%H6651><s%> up dust <S%H6083><s%>, and taketh it <S%H3920><s%>.
Then shall he sweep <S%H2498><s%> by as a wind <S%H7307><s%>, and shall pass over <S%H5674><s%>, and be guilty <S%H816><s%>, even he whose <S%H2098><s%> might <S%H3581><s%> is his god <S%H433><s%>.

Art not thou from everlasting <S%H6924><s%>, O Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> my God <S%H430><s%>, my Holy One <S%H6918><s%>? we shall not die <S%H4191><s%>. O Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, thou hast ordained <S%H7760><s%> him for judgment <S%H4941><s%>; and thou <S%H6697><s%>, O Rock, hast established <S%H3245><s%> him for correction <S%H3198><s%>.

Thou that art of purer <S%H2889><s%> eyes <S%H5869><s%> than to behold <S%H7200><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%>, and that canst <S%H3201><s%> not look <S%H5027><s%> on perverseness <S%H5999><s%>, wherefore lookest <S%H5027><s%> thou upon them that deal treacherously <S%H898><s%>, and holdest thy peace <S%H2790><s%> when the wicked <S%H7563><s%> swalloweth <S%H1104><s%> up the man that is more righteous than he <S%H6662><s%>;
and makest <S%H6213><s%> men <S%H120><s%> as the fishes <S%H1709><s%> of the sea <S%H3220><s%>, as the creeping things <S%H7431><s%>, that have no ruler over them <S%H4910><s%>?

He taketh up <S%H5927><s%> all of them with the angle <S%H2443><s%>, he catcheth <S%H1641><s%> them in his net <S%H2764><s%>, and gathereth <S%H622><s%> them in his drag <S%H4365><s%>: therefore he rejoiceth <S%H8055><s%> and is glad <S%H1523><s%>.

Therefore he sacrificeth <S%H2076><s%> unto his net <S%H2764><s%>, and burneth incense <S%H6999><s%> unto his drag <S%H4365><s%>; because by them <S%H1992><s%> his portion <S%H2506><s%> is fat <S%H8082><s%>, and his food <S%H3978><s%> plenteous <S%H1277><s%>.
Shall he therefore empty <S%H7324><s%> his net <S%H2764><s%>, and spare <S%H2550><s%> not to slay <S%H2026><s%> the nations <S%H1471><s%> continually <S%H8548><s%>?
